Rewterz Threat Advisory Multiple WordPress Plugin Vulnerabilities

chapter.title: CVE-2022-0953 CVSS:6.1
chapter.text: Anti-Malware Security and Brute-Force Firewall plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the QUERY_STRING in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victims Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victims cookie-based authentication credentials.

report.title: Rewterz Threat Advisory Multiple WordPress Plugin Vulnerabilities

chapter.title: CVE-2022-1153 CVSS:5.5
chapter.text: LayerSlider plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the template slug of any slider. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victims Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victims cookie-based authentication credentials.

chapter.text:

WordPress Anti-Malware Security and Brute-Force Firewall plugin for WordPress 4.20.59
WordPress Anti-Malware Security and Brute-Force Firewall plugin for WordPress 4.20.59

report.title: Rewterz Threat Advisory Multiple WordPress Plugin Vulnerabilities

chapter.title: Remediation
chapter.text:
Upgrade to the latest version of Anti-Malware Security and Brute-Force Firewall plugin for WordPress and LayerSlider plugin for WordPress, available from the WordPress Web site.
